description: All tables related to Log Analytics Workspaces.

tables.name: LAQueryLogs
tables.description: Audit logs for queries executed in Log Analytics Workspaces.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) at which the query was submitted.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated events.

columns.name: AADObjectId
columns.description: AAD ObjectId of the caller.

columns.name: AADTenantId
columns.description: AAD TenantId of the caller.

columns.name: AADEmail
columns.description: AAD Email of the caller.

columns.name: AADClientId
columns.description: AAD ClientId used by the caller.

columns.name: ConditionalDataAccess
columns.description: Indicates whether the query was executed with an applicable attribute-based access control data access condition (ABAC), and if the condition had an error.

columns.name: QueryTimeRangeStart
columns.description: The starting time (UTC) of the time range across which the query was was requested by the caller to be executed.

columns.name: QueryTimeRangeEnd
columns.description: The end time (UTC) of the time range across which the query was was requested by the caller to be executed.

columns.name: QueryText
columns.description: The full body of the query as submitted by the user.

columns.name: RequestClientApp
columns.description: ClientApp string in the request header (x-ms-app).

columns.name: RequestTarget
columns.description: ResourceId of the request URL.

columns.name: RequestContext
columns.description: ResourceId of all referenced workspaces, applications, and resources across which the query was requested by the caller to be executed.

columns.name: RequestContextFilters
columns.description: Filters applied to the request context.

columns.name: ResponseCode
columns.description: The HTTP response code for the request.

columns.name: ResponseRowCount
columns.description: The number of rows that were returned.

columns.name: ResponseDurationMs
columns.description: The duration (in ms) that the query took to execute.

columns.name: StatsCPUTimeMs
columns.description: The CPU (in ms) used in the execution of this query.

columns.name: StatsDataProcessedKB
columns.description: [Deprecated] - The total KB of data that was processed as part of the query.

columns.name: StatsDataProcessedStart
columns.description: The starting time (UTC) of the time range across which the data processed.

columns.name: StatsDataProcessedEnd
columns.description: The end time (UTC) of the time range across which the data processed.

columns.name: StatsWorkspaceCount
columns.description: The number of workspaces that the query accessed, either explicitly or otherwise.

columns.name: StatsRegionCount
columns.description: The number of regions that the workspaces accessed are spread across.

columns.name: IsBillableQuery
columns.description: Indicates whether query execution is billed.

columns.name: ScannedGB
columns.description: For billable queries, like Basic logs queries, indicates the total GB of data scanned in the query.

columns.name: WorkspaceRegion
columns.description: The region of the queried workspace.

columns.name: IsWorkspaceInFailover
columns.description: Indicates whether the queried workspace was in failover mode.

tables.name: LASummaryLogs
tables.description: Provides Summary logs rules execution details, including run status, duration and errors. Can be used to view bins executions statuses, identify rules that take a long time to complete, and failures that could be optimized in query, or shorted bin time.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The bin execution start time (UTC). It represents the time bin processing started, and decoupled from bin time range. For example, TimeGenerated can be 2023-01-01T3:05:10.123Z when processing hourly bin between 2:00 - 3:00.

columns.name: BinStartTime
columns.description: The bin start time (UTC). For example, value can be 2023-01-01T2:00:00.000Z for bin processed between 2:00 - 3:00.

columns.name: BinSize
columns.description: The time ranges summarization is performed in minutes. For example, when bin is 60, summarization is performed every 60 minutes.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: The bin execution status. Can be Started, Succeeded or Failed.

columns.name: QueryDurationMs
columns.description: The execution duration in milliseconds.

columns.name: ResultsRecordCount
columns.description: The number of records returned in aggregation.

columns.name: Message
columns.description: An error message when applicable.

columns.name: RuleName
columns.description: The rule name.

columns.name: RuleLastModifiedTime
columns.description: The time the rule last modified. Can be used to reason changes in results, duration, etc.

tables.name: AzureMetricsV2
tables.description: Azure native platform metrics that can help to measure health and performance. AzureMetricsV2 includes metric categories and dimensions, improving upon legacy AzureMetrics table.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Timestamp (UTC) when the record was generated.

columns.name: SourceSystem
columns.description: Source of the record.

columns.name: MetricResourceType
columns.description: Resource type of the Azure resource reporting the metric.

columns.name: MetricName
columns.description: Display name of the metric.

columns.name: MetricCategory
columns.description: Category name of the metric.

columns.name: Total
columns.description: Sum of all of the values in the time range.

columns.name: Count
columns.description: Number of samples collected during the time range.

columns.name: Maximum
columns.description: Maximum value collected during in the time range.

columns.name: Minimum
columns.description: Minimum value collected during in the time range.

columns.name: Average
columns.description: Average value collected during in the time range.

columns.name: TimeGrain
columns.description: Time grain of the metric.

columns.name: UnitName
columns.description: Unit of the metric.

columns.name: Dimension
columns.description: Associated dimension of the metric in JSON format.

tables.name: LAJobLogs
tables.description: Provides information about jobs executions (e.g. Export Job) within Log Analytics workspace. Including job status, duration, and errors.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time (UTC) of each status change in the job.

columns.name: JobType
columns.description: The type of the job. e.g. 'Export'.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The correlation ID of the Job action. Can be used to reference with logs from other tables, like AzureActivity, or included in support cases.

columns.name: JobId
columns.description: The ID of the job. Can be used as operationId in the operation resource URI (in request response) to get the jobâ€™s status or cancel a job.

columns.name: SourceTable
columns.description: The table(s) used in the job's query.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: The job's status, including 'Started', 'Succeeded', 'Canceled, 'Failed'.

columns.name: ResultsRecordCount
columns.description: The number of records in the job's result.

columns.name: ResultsGB
columns.description: The results volume in Gigabytes. e.g. the number of Gigabytes exported to Storage Account.

columns.name: Message
columns.description: A message describing the job's operation or error.

columns.name: Destination
columns.description: The destination information based on the JobType. e.g. 'Export' includes the export target container name and storage Accounts.

queries.description: Most queried resources over the last 24 hours.
Get a list of unauthorized users with their request count in last 24 hours.
Get a list of throttled users with their request count in last 24 hours.
Request count by response code within 1 min buckets in last 1 hour.
Get top 10 resource intesive queries (based on CPU consumption) in last 24 hours.
Get top 10 queries that scanned the longest time range in last 24 hours.
Get a list of bin rules with their query duration.
List jobs in progress with details.
